actions.name: Flickering Flames
actions.detail: Select a character within Sensors and Line of Sight that is currently suffering from Burn. You take 1d6 Burn, up of their current Burn, and they clear the same amount. The target then takes AP energy damage equal to the Burn cleared.

name: Vent Reactor
effect: When you take any Structure Damage, this system is destroyed and you take 1d6 Burn that cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.
description: The Firefly's prototype- the Incandis, or “Glowfly”- was notorious for its "leaking" reactor due to a fault in the shielding plates. The Firefly weaponizes this tendency to both damage enemies and protect its allies, but the modification can be put on any frame with the proper tools.

actions.name: Open The Vents
actions.detail: They must make an Engineering Save. On failure, they take Burn Damage equal to half your current Burn and become Slowed until the end of their next turn.
actions.trigger: A hostile character starts their turn within Line of Sight and Sensors.

actions.name: Devour Flame
actions.trigger: An Allied Character within Line of Sight and Sensor Range takes Burn or makes a check to put out Burn.

name: Emergency Fire Extinguisher
effect: As a Quick Action, expend a charge of this system to clear all Burn on yourself or an Adjacent ally.

name: Reactive Shield Armor System
effect:
While Stunned, gain RESISTANCE to all damage and Heat, and Immunity to the Shredded Condition.

In addition, when you Brace, you may opt to become Immune to the damage from the triggering attack, but become Stunned until the end of your next turn afterwards.

name: Retractable Plating
effect: This System’s effects do not stack with other copies of itself if activated through a “Eusocial” Tag.

actions.name: Activate Retractable Plating
actions.detail: While this system is active, you and any adjacent allied characters and deployables gain +2 Armor (even going past the maximum of 4 Armor), but your speed is halved.

actions.name: Deactivate Retractable Plating
actions.detail: Deactivate Retractable Plating, making you and any adjacent allied characters and deployables lose the additional +2 armor, but your speed is no longer halved.

name: Wireless Shield Transfer
description: By using specific wavelengths of energy, ablative screens can be transmitted to create temporary reactive armor for endangered allies.

actions.name: Transfer Shield
actions.detail: You may transfer any number of Overshield you possess to that allied character.
actions.trigger: An Allied Character within HiveMind range would take damage from an attack.

name: HiveMind Command: "Hive Targeting Network"
effect:
When you or an Allied Character within HiveMind Range consumes Lock On, on a hit, they deal Bonus Burn equal to their GRIT. This can only be done 1/round per character.

HiveMind Programs are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state.
description: KIE Mechs are designed to create localized HiveMinds for increased coordination. This program is capable of optimizing defensive capabilities for an entire team, though it is vulnerable to being broken up by Electronic Countermeasures.

synergies.detail: When an Allied Character within HiveMind Range consumes Lock On, on a hit, they deal Bonus Burn equal to their GRIT. This can only be done 1/round per character.

name: HiveMind Command: "Strength In Numbers"
effect:
When you or an Allied Character within HiveMind range becomes Bolstered, both they and the Bolsterer gain the effects of Bolster, along with OVERSHIELD equal to their GRIT. This Overshield stacks with previous instances of Overshield, but cannot exceed the character’s maximum HP.

HiveMind Programs are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state.

synergies.detail: When an Allied Character within HiveMind range becomes Bolstered, both they and the Bolsterer gain the effects of Bolster, along with OVERSHIELD equal to their GRIT. This Overshield stacks with previous instances of Overshield, but cannot exceed the character’s maximum HP.

name: Spare Parts Storage
effect: 1/Mission, when you expend all used Repairs, regain 2 Repairs. If this system is destroyed, so are any Repairs granted from this System.
description: “Oh, you know… figured I’d just pack some extra plating, nano-gel, maybe some duct tape, too. Never hurts.” - Tyze Kyre, Rubblefolk Salvager and Field Mechanic

name: Scrap Charges
description: “This thing? I just strapped a bunch of spare munitions, knives and bolts to a broken fuel cell. No, it’s not safe at all. Why do you ask?” - Tyze Kyre, Rubblefolk Salvager and Field Mechanic

actions.name: Scrap Grenade
actions.detail: All characters within the affected area must succeed at a Hull Save or take 2AP kinetic damage (or 1d3+1 if they are BIOLOGICAL) and become Shredded until the end of your next turn. On a success, they take half damage.

deployables.name: Shrapnel Mine
deployables.detail: When a character moves over or adjacent to this mine, it explodes releasing sharp fragments around it. Characters within the affected area must succeed on a Hull save or take 1d6+1AP kinetic damage and become Shredded until the end of the end of your next turn. Biological characters gain +2 Difficulty on this save and also become Impaired and Slowed on a fail.

name: Biosteel Surgery
effect: During a rest, you can expend a charge of this system to repair one destroyed system or weapon of an ally or yourself, without expending Repairs.
description: “STAY PUT! NO! NO! LEMME JUST- *crack* Phew, there. Now stop cryin’ and go back to work.” - Denzel Kyre, Rubblefolk Heartfixer.

actions.name: Biosteel Surgery
actions.detail: Use a charge, one of your repairs and take 2 heat to select either yourself or an adjacent allied character. The target can immediately repair one destroyed weapon or system.

name: Mechano-Anatomic Insight
description: “Mind and body should work as one. You’ve got clogged veins, broken joints and are crazy as a drunk tumblebug, your body and mind hate each other, and it shows.” - Denzel Kyre, Rubblefolk Heartfixer.

actions.name: Force Homeostasis
actions.detail: Choose one allied character within sensors and line of sight. They can make an Engineering check to clear the Shredded, Impaired, Slowed and Stunned conditions, making a separate check for each condition and taking 2 heat for each condition successfully cleared.

actions.name: Digital Serenity
actions.detail: Choose one allied character within sensors and line of sight. Your target’s cascading NHPs return to a normal state and their systems become shielded until the end of their next turn. During this time, tech attacks made against them receive +2 Difficulty and the attacker takes 2 heat on a miss.

name: Hivemind Command: "Colonial Stabilization"
effect: HiveMind Programs are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state.
description: KIE Mechs are designed to create localized HiveMinds for increased coordination. This program is designed for in-the-field rapid intensive maintenance uses, though it suffers the same weaknesses to ECM and other counter-tech capabilities as other programs.

actions.name: Colonial Stabilization
actions.detail:
Consume a charge of this system to cause one of the following effects:

  • A character of your choice adjacent to the triggering character may take 2 heat to Stabilize as a reaction

  • The triggering character may choose 2 of the secondary options when Stabilizing.
actions.trigger: You or an allied character within Hivemind range takes the Stabilize Action.

name: Thumper Chamber
effect:
When you reload any weapon, your next attack with a Loading weapon gains this effect:


Hit or Miss, create a LINE 5 path in any direction from the primary target. Those in the path must pass an AGILITY Save or take 1d6 Explosive Damage, and the affected area becomes Difficult Terrain until the end of the Scene.

name: HiveMind Command: "Optimized Targeting"
effect:
You and allied characters within HiveMind Range gain +3 Range or +1 Threat with weapons that possess the Ranged or Threat properties.

HiveMind Programs are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state.
